concept.title: Task Topics
concept.shortdesc: Task topics explain how to accomplish specific goals through step-by-step procedures.

section.p: Task topics provide clear steps on how to achieve a specific business goal, for what reason, and in which context. For example, task topics describe how and when to create specific business data, configure a system or device, or complete a procedure.

section.title: User Intent
section.p: "I want to complete a task and understand how and why I need to do this."

ul.li: <title>: Task to be performed (for example, "Reset Your Password").
<shortdesc>: Precise summary of the goal and when to perform the task.
<prereq>: Any prerequisites to be met before performing the task.
<context>: Additional background information about performing the task.
One action per numbered step (max. 10 steps).
Use imperative voice (for example, "Save your data.").
Include expected results for complex steps.
Provide specific UI element names but remember that the UI can change.
Use conditional steps for different scenarios.
Test task topics with actual users to identify gaps and ensure clarity.

section.title: Sample XML Code
section.codeblock: <task id="resetpassword"> <title>Reset Your Password</title> <shortdesc>Reset your account password using email verification if you've forgotten your password or suspect that your account has been hacked.</shortdesc> <taskbody> <steps> <step>Go to the login page and click "Forgot Password".</step> <step>Enter your registered email address.</step> <step>Follow the link sent to your email to set a new password.</step> </steps> <result>Your password is now updated and you can log in.</result> </taskbody> </task>
